greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A001222(A285323(n)).
comment: The sequence is completely determined by the positions of two least significant 1-bits of n: After initial zero, if n is a power of two (only one 1-bit present) or if prime(1+A285099(n)) > prime(1+A007814(n))^2, a(n) = 2, otherwise a(n) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
program: def a001222(n): return 0 if n<2 else a001222(n//min(primefactors(n))) + 1
def a019565(n): return reduce(mul, (prime(i+1) for i, v in enumerate(bin(n)[:1:-1]) if v == '1')) if n > 0 else 1 # This function from _Chai Wah Wu_
def a007947(n): return 1 if n<2 else reduce(mul, primefactors(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(121)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 20 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 19 2017
